Title: Be Alert
Body: "Always be alert and aware of the people around you."

Title: Prevention
Body: "Educate yourself concerning prevention tactics."

Title: Be Aware
Body: "Be aware of locations and situations which would make you appear vulnerable to crime
CreatedAt: such as alleys and dark parking lots."

Title: Be Alert
Body: "Be alert to your surroundings and the people around you—especially if you are alone or it is dark."

Title: Stronger Together
Body: "Whenever possible

Title: Stay in the Light
Body: "Stay in well-lighted areas as much as possible."

Title: Stay Clear
Body: "Walk close to the curb. Avoid doorways
CreatedAt: bushes and alleys where someone could hide."

Title: Distractions Kill
Body: "Do not use or wear anything that will impede your vision or hearing (i.e. iPods)."

Title: Keep Walking
Body: "Do not respond to conversation from strangers on the street—continue walking."

Title: Eye Contact
Body: "Make eye contact with people when walking."

Title: Confidence
Body: "Walk confidently at a steady pace."

Title: Purse Safety
Body: "If you carry a purse
CreatedAt: carry it securely between your arm and your body. Although a purse-snatcher's intent is to steal the purse
updatedAt: your personal safety may depend on not clinging to it."

Title: Lock It
Body: "Always lock your car doors after entering or leaving your vehicle."

Title: Parking
Body: "Park in well-lighted areas."

Title: Keys
Body: "Have your car keys in your hand so you don't have to linger before entering your car."

Title: Look First
Body: "Check the interior of your vehicle for intruders before entering your car."

Title: Find a cop
Body: "If you think you are being followed
CreatedAt: drive to a public place or a police or sheriff station."

Title: Flag Them Down
Body: "If your car breaks down
CreatedAt: open the hood and attach a white cloth to the car antennae. If someone stops to help
updatedAt: stay in your locked car and ask them to call the police
column5: sheriff or a tow truck service."

Title: Don't stop
Body: "Don't stop to aid motorists by the side of the road. Make a phone call requesting help for them."

Title: Taking the Bus
Body: "Try to avoid isolated bus stops."

Title: Money on Display
Body: "Don't open your purse or wallet while boarding the bus—have your pass or money already in your hand."

Title: Shiny Things
Body: "Keep jewelry out of sight; don't flash jewelry; turn rings around so the stones don't show."

Title: Pockets
Body: "Be alert to pickpocketers on crowded buses; check your purse or wallet if someone is jostling

Title: In the Front
Body: "Keep your belongings in front of you and hold close to your body with both hands."
